larachel5.name: L'Arachel
larachel5.title: Justice-Armed
larachel5.description: Niece of Mansel, the Divine Emperor of Rausten. With a new weapon at her side, she travels the land preaching justice and order. Appears in Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones.

Castle Hall: Ahh... This reminds me of the tea parties I had in my Rausten Palace. I shall invite you over some time.

The Stones of Grado, Frelia, and Jehanna are gone, but hope is not.
The Stone of Rausten is safe, after all.
No need to worry. I'm not on my own. I have my friends who share the same aspirations.
I am not lost! Dozla and Rennac ran off somewhere and abandoned me!
Ivaldi and the Staff of Latona are the Sacred Twin relics of Saint Latona, most holy father of Rausten!
Visit:
So, you are a friend of [F]'s?
Well then, now you are considered a friend of the beautiful princess of peerless beauty, me!
Level: It is time for me to be on my way, my friends. As the princess of Rausten, I still have many duties to perform.
Friends of justice! Allies of order and righteousness! I, L'Arachel, have arrived! Now, I shall deliver justice!
But...I am the beautiful princess of peerless beauty. This must be a mistake!
Summon: My name is L'Arachel, the hidden and beautiful princess of peerless beauty! You have my permission to call me so!
Learn Skill: Very well, then. Feast your eyes on my magnificent performance!
Confession:
You seem to be quite determined to battle evil day in and day out, [S]!
And even considering the Demon King himself has gowned a puppet to infiltrate the world of us humans...
Unforgivable! He eats away at people's hearts, taking control of them!
Reverting the hearts that have been tainted with evil is tantamount to raising the dead.
With Saint Latona's relics—No! Not even with the power of the Sacred Stones would it be possible...
You must have caution! Do not speak the name of the Demon King without care.
Of course, you understand my worry.
Status: I shall heal you.
I'm not finished yet.
"Beautiful princess of peerless beauty" doesn't quite fit anymore... I must think of a new introduction that matches my radiance with this new power.
It's understandable that you would be so captivated by me.
I'll eradicate all the evils of this world with my new power!
Father, Mother... Worry not, for I have grown stronger.
Our meeting was fashioned by the gods.

lute3.name: Lute
lute3.title: Limitless Curiosity
lute3.description: An exceptional mage, acknowledged as such by herself as well as others. She pursues the potential of magic with rare talent. Appears in Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones.

Castle Hall: A different world. Different cultures. As long as language exists, I'll achieve understanding. I am superior, after all.
This monster is merely the beginning. As my research progresses, I may try this for mauthe doogs and cyclopes.
When Grandmother said my father and mother were traveling in distant lands, could she have meant like this?
A warm beverage can help to heat you up from within when you have morning or evening chills.
Ah! Hearing someone call out to me so suddenly is startling. Even when it's you, [S].
Visit: Requests from others are classified into seven categories and 25 items. That's how I manage my errands.
Level: I predicted this outcome from the beginning. After all, I'm Lute, genius mage extraordinaire.
Are you really getting back up? It doesn't bother me. I'll simply deal with you again.
This is a good resource for measuring fortune. Mages obtaining this solution may one day control peoples' fates.
Summon: I am Lute. I'm a mage! Possibly the best. I may subdue monsters like this with my superior talent and research.
Learn Skill: Very interesting... I will help myself.
Confession:
While deciphering a piece from A Young Girl's Primer to Nazonian Magic, I realized something.
The best way to research monsters is to live with one.
That's why I have this mogall. Not to feed or care for it, but ultimately to research it.
We should be able to keep monsters in check. Once I finish my research, no one will have to fear them.
Since I also research you, having you live here should move things along. My mogall will welcome a new ally.
Whether summoner or monster, I will treat you equally. After all...I am superior.
Status: It's time I demonstrate the results of my new research.
*gasp* Oh, it's you. I thought it might have been a tentacle.
I'm researching this mogall's behavior. Don't worry, it's completely harmless.
It would be a benefit to humanity if I were able to control all monsters.
Again? Why do people keep screaming and running away in fear?
I have fallen. For my own excellence, of course.
I'm sure my brilliant mind will be useful to you.

franz.name: Franz
franz.title: The Faithful
franz.description: A knight of Renais who has just finished his tenure as squire. He is an earnest and kind individual. Appears in Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones.

Castle Hall: Please, allow me to fight beside you, [S]!
I've just finished my time as a squire, but...I am every bit a knight of Renais.
Even if you act lazy as part of your charm, once the battle starts, everyone will see how sharp you are.
Holding my fishing pole like this, I can feel my spear arm getting stronger, which gives me a sense of calm.
One day, I want to be a great knight like General Seth.
Visit: I'm Franz, a knight of Renais. I'm here on an errand from [F]'s castle.
Level: I'll keep pushing forward for Renais, and become a knight as great as my brother.
I wonder... Have I gotten a little stronger at least?
Looks like I still need more training...
Summon: I'm Franz, a knight of Renais. I've only just finished my time as a squire, but I'm here to do my best!
Learn Skill: There must be something that I can do!
Confession:
This will be a tough battle, [S]...
I've been busy myself. I'm sort of embarrassed to say, but...this satchel I made seems to be pretty popular.
There's a pouch on the side for a skin of water, a place for food, and even a hidden pocket for herbs.
I designed it so it won't shake while riding, and you can carry it on your back or sling it over your shoulders.
It feels good making something that everyone appreciates... It's probably my only redeeming trait.
I've made one embroidered with your name, [S]. I hope you put it to good use!
Status: I'm Franz, every bit a knight of Renais.
Oh! I-I thought you were Forde for a moment.
Is there some place around here I could go fishing? Not while I'm on duty, of course.
General Seth, the Silver Knight, is my hero.
The only memory I have of my father was a deep scar he got from battle. But I know...he was a brave knight.
Someday, I will become a knight even greater than my brother or my father.
If you're tired, I can teach you some traditional relaxation exercises from Renais.

morva.name: Morva
morva.title: Darkling Warden
morva.description: Leader of the dragon tribe who once stood by humanity during a battle in the distant past. He has a longstanding conflict with Fomortiis, the Demon King. Appears in Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones.

Castle Hall:
The protection of the blessed stones is lost. The dark is rising.
King of shadows...they appear to be waiting for you.
Hundreds of years later, Demon King, you can clothe yourself in human flesh, but cannot hide your foul mien.
Myrrh left the woods long ago in pursuit of the Demon King. I hope she is well...
It seems those who gather here all bear an unusual destiny. You are no exception, [S].
I bear this form, but I am a dragonkin from Magvel. It would be better if I avoided interacting with humankind.
Visit:
I agree with [F].
Moving forward, it may be necessary for us manaketes to learn about the lives of humans.
Level: I cannot abandon humankind to the Demon King. In this land, he shall be defeated again as he was long ago.
I live and breathe to protect all.
Myrrh, do not concern yourself with me. Continue to follow the path you have chosen.
Summon:
I am Morva. Several hundred years ago, I sealed away the darkness that nests in Magvel.
The undying roots of corruption still plague the land.
Learn Skill: I never imagined I would gain yet new strength after having lived for a millennia...
Confession:
A long time ago, deep in the woods in Magvel, I defeated the Demon King alongside heroes with Sacred Stones.
The blood he shed sullied the land. Rot and poison ever flowed from his corpse into the once-beautiful forest.
For several hundred years, monsters that spawned from the filth awaited the return of their progenitor.
Darkness nestled within life itself. An evil soul consuming hearts and minds. Demon King Fomortiis's true form.
We must defend the people. Should the Demon King be resurrected, we will destroy him once again.
Summoner, when you and your allies realize how terrifying he truly is, only then you will understand my words.
Status: I am Morva, leader of the dragons, guardian of the Darkling Woods.
*react* Oh, I thought you were Myrrh.
Ancient king of shadows... They appear to be waiting for you.
I live and breathe to protect mankind. I cannot abandon them to evil.
Myrrh left the woods long ago to test the limits of evil's influence. Could she have... No...
Myrrh, I hope you are unharmed...
You have proven yourself honorable. I will place my trust in you.

garcia.name: Garcia
garcia.title: Warrior Reborn
garcia.description: A warrior hailing from the village of Ide in Renais. He is a former military commander, feared for his might. Appears in Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones.

Castle Hall: Before I knew it, my son had become a warrior. He turned out just fine without my help...
I quit fighting so I could be with my family. At least, that was my intention. But now...I must fight once more!
You can't fight on an empty stomach. Eating is very important to keep up your strength. Especially breakfast.
The army's full of young men who are strong in their specific fields but weak in others.
I'm preparing myself for the battle. Please don't come near me right now.
Visit: I'm Garcia, father of Ross the warrior. I ask that you take good care of my son should the time arise.
Level: I won't give up the fight. For the future of all children.
If you want to survive this war, you must focus on the enemy before you. The others can wait till later.
Summon: I'm Garcia. I may be a little fatigued, but I've still got some fight left in me. Allow me to fight.
Learn Skill: I have no regrets, nothing to fear.
Confession:
I was once lionized for my strength. But, being in battle after battle, I had neglected my family.
It all changed when my wife died of illness. When I could barely recognize my son's face, I realized my error...
I swore on my wife's grave that I would be a father from that moment on. So I quit the army.
I would never allow myself to forget that I am Ross's only father.
Even he grew up to be a valiant warrior. Now, I fight for a better future for the people.
What do you say we fight together, [S]?
Status: These old bones still have some fight left in them, if you'll have me.
*react* Don't surprise a man with an axe, if you value your fingers.
I used to pass the time practicing archery with a friend... I hope he's well.
How is my son? Behaving sensibly, I hope.
There's no greater tragedy than when a parent must bury his child.
Risa, you'd be so happy. Ross has grown into a strong young man.
If I accomplished anything in this life, I raised a strong warrior.
